result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert W Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count #2, Walworth County Case 2015CF191, but consecutive to any sentence now serving.
-------------------------------
9/19/2016 - CORRECTION:  Correcting language on JOC filed 09-05-2016 to reflect that the sentence is to run concurrent with Count #2 and not Count  #1 of  Walworth County Case 2015CF191, but consecutive to any sentence now serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-----------------------------------

No alcohol. Not to possess or consume controlled substances. No prescribed medications without a valid prescription and must be taken within the terms of the prescription. Not to enter any taverns or liquor stores except if grocery store or restaurant.
-----------------------------------

Participate in any counseling recommended by the Agent including AODA, anger management and DV counseling.
-----------------------------------
Comply with sex offender registry requirements.
-----------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-----------------------------------

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Robert W Brown
Current: PO Box 4000 - #546220, c/o New Lisbon Correctoinal Institution, New Lisbon, WI 53950 United States  (Effective: 10-31-2016)
Prior: 2601 Campbell St., Rolling Meadows, IL 60008 United States
Original filed with court.
Application for Jail Time Credit form
Temporary Commitment form filed
BOND QUASHED

10:00 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Atty Haley Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Robert W Brown in court, in custody with Atty Michelle Marie Anderson.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing on files 2015CF191, 2015CF224 and 2015CT149.  
Court recites charges and maximum potential penalties.  
Parties agreed at time of plea hearing that rather than order a new PSI, they would rely upon the PSI filed on the deft's Kenosha County cases.  
Attys have reviewed the PSI that was filed in Kenosha County.  Atty Anderson indicates that Mr. Brown has also reviewed the PSI.  Atty Anderson makes record with regard to a correction to the PSI in that the deft  acknowledged to the Probation Agent that he did have a problem with alcohol.  Atty Anderson has no other corrections or additions to the report.  
There were no victims that needed to be identified for today's sentencing hearing.    
10:05 am  Atty Johnson makes record as to her understanding of plea agreement.  The sentence on each of the files would be concurrent with each other but State would argue that they be consecutive to any other sentence.  Atty Anderson confirms that agreement.  
10:06 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Johnson.  
10:12 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Anderson.  
10:26 am  Discussion concerning sentence credit.  Atty Anderson believes that any credit he would have had has been applied against his Kenosha County sentence.  Court makes record with regard to bail that deft had on his Walworth County cases at various times.  Atty Anderson will look into this.  
10:27 am  Statement by Deft.  
10:30 am  Response by Deft to Court's questions.  
10:31 am  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the deft.  
Atty Anderson requests the return of the seized vehicle.  The deft's mother is the owner of the vehicle.  No objection by Atty Johnson on behalf of the State.  COURT ORDERS RETURN OF THE SEiZED VEHICLE TO THE DEFENDANT'S MOTHER.    

FILE 2015CF000191 - Ct #2 - Escape:  
18 months IC followed by 3 yrs ES for a total length of sentence of 4 yrs & 6 months, consecutive to any sentence now serving  

FILE:  2015CF000224 - Ct #1 - Sex Offender Registry Violation  
18 months IC followed by 3 yrs ES for a total length of sentence of 4 yrs & 6 months, concurrent with Count #2, Walworth County Case 2015CF000191, but consecutive to any sentence now serving  

Court finds deft NOT eligible for CIP but IS eligible for SAP

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
1)  No alcohol.  Not to possess or consume controlled substances.  No prescribed medications without a valid prescription and must be taken within the terms of the prescription.  Not to enter any tavern or liquor stores except if grocery store or restaurant.  
2)  Not to possess any weapons.  
3)  Participate in any counseling recommended by the Agent including AODA, anger management and DV counseling.  
4)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
5)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
6)  Comply with sex offender registry requirements.  

---------------------------------------------------------
FILE 2015CT000149:  
One (1) year in the county jail, concurrent with sentences on Walworth County Cases 2015CF000191 and 2015CF000224, but consecutive to any sentence now serving.  
Pay $600.00 fine plus court costs  
Complete A & R  
---------------------------------------------------------
Court gives defendant warnings with regard to voting ineligibility and firearms restriction.  

10:47 am  Court in recess.
Atty Michelle Marie Anderson
Original filed with court.
Kenosha County PSI
